item.title: Bibliography
item.description: Download the bibliography Make a suggestion Adams N (2012). A Synthesis of Rights-of-Way Native Plant Communities: Identifying their Relevance to Historical and Contemporary Piedmont Savannas. Master’s thesis, University of North Carolina Chapel Hill. doi: 10.17615/95cd-wc51 (URL: https://doi.org/10.17615/95cd-wc51). Askins R (2001). “Sustaining Biological Diversity in Early Successional Communities: The Challenge of Managing Unpopular Habitats.” Wildlife Society Bulletin, 29(2). <URL: http://www.jstor.org/stable/3784165>. Barden LS (1997). “Historic prairies in the Piedmont of North and South Carolina, USA.

item.title: Get involved
item.description: Community Science Projects North Carolina Piedmont Roadside Native Plants Southern Piedmont Pine-Oak Savannas Restoration Projects and Guides McDowell Nature Center and Preserve: “The piedmont prairie restoration area of the preserve provides habitat for a federally endangered plant: Schweinitz’s sunflower, a federal candidate species: Georgia aster, and one rare plant: prairie dock.” How to restore a native grass meadow: Horton Grove Nature Preserve Success Story
